meanings.definition: A person who resists or defies authority, control, or tradition.
meanings.sent1: The rebel stood up against the strict rules at school.
meanings.sent2: The rebel refused to follow the orders given by the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The rebel tried to sneak out of the house past curfew but got caught.
meanings.sent4: Her rebellious spirit was like a spark igniting a fire of change.
meanings.sent5: The image of the rebel wearing a leather jacket and sunglasses was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To resist or defy authority, control, or tradition.
meanings.sent1: She decided to rebel against the unfair treatment she received.
meanings.sent2: The workers rebelled against the new company policies.
meanings.sent3: The cat would rebel against wearing the cute costume his owner picked out.
meanings.sent4: His determination to rebel against the odds was inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The waves rebelled against the shore, crashing with fierce independence.

meanings.definition: Of or characteristic of a rebel; rebellious.
meanings.sent1: Her rebel attitude was evident in the way she challenged authority.
meanings.sent2: The rebel nature of the graffiti art gave the city a vibrant energy.
meanings.sent3: The rebellious puppy would rebel against any attempt to put a leash on him.
meanings.sent4: The rebel spirit of the music festival was contagious, making everyone dance.
meanings.sent5: The rebel colors of red and black symbolized strength and defiance.
